children.label: shr.action
children.description: The Action domain contains base definitions for interventions and procedures, from education to surgery.

children.label: ActionContext
children.description: The ontological status of the intervention, e.g., performed/not performed, requested/not requested.

children.label: ActionTopic
children.description: An entry related to an action or intervention, whether potential or actual, past or future. An intervention is an action addressing a undesired health state, behavior, risk, or goal.

children.label: CommunicationMethod
children.description: This is the method the provider used to communicate. Examples include: Written, Telephoned, Verbal, Electronically Entered, Policy, Service Correction, Duplicate, etc. 'Code indicating the origin of the prescription.' - NCPDP Telecommunication (Field 419-DJ, Data Dictionary 201104). Possible values include: Written; Telephone; Electronic; Facsimile; Pharmacy; Not Known.

children.label: ExpectedMethod
children.description: The method that should be used to carry out the action.

children.label: ExpectedPerformanceTime
children.description: When an action should be done. If the action is a series or recurs (e.g. daily blood sugar testing in the morning) then a Timing can be used to describe the periodicity.

children.label: ExpectedPerformer
children.description: Who should carry out the tests. For example, the patient or caregiver.

children.label: ExpectedPerformerType
children.description: What type of party should carry out the testing.

children.label: Method
children.description: The technique used to carry out an action, for example, the specific imaging technical or assessment vehicle.

children.label: NotPerformedContext
children.description: A record that a clinical act was not performed at a certain time or during a stated period of time, particularly when there might be an expectation of performing such an act, for example, if a vaccination is not given because of parental objection. Do not use this context if the act was initiated or started but aborted or cancelled.

children.label: Outcome
children.description: The result of performing an action or behavior, for example, an adverse reaction or new finding.

children.label: Participant
children.description: An object (usually a Person, Party, or Organization but potentially a device or other Object) that participates in a task or activity.

children.label: ParticipationPeriod
children.description: The point in time or span of time the participant is involved.

children.label: ParticipationType
children.description: The role played by the participant engaged in the action, for example, as the attending physician, surgical assistant, etc.

children.label: PatientInstructions
children.description: Information for the patient, such as, where to get the test, how to prepare for the test, etc.

children.label: PerformedContext
children.description: ActionContext indicating actual performance or execution of a healthcare-related action, e.g., 3rd dose of Hepatitis B vaccine administered on Dec 4th 2012, appendectomy performed today.

children.label: PerformerInstructions
children.description: Information for the performer of the test, if needed.

children.label: RelatedPlan
children.description: The plan that this action fulfills

children.label: RelatedRequest
children.description: The request that this action fulfills

children.label: RequestedAgainstContext
children.description: Represents a recommendation or order from a practitioner or clinical decision support system to NOT perform an act.

children.label: RequestedContext
children.description: An order for something to take place.

children.label: RequestIntent
children.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the request and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

children.label: Status
children.description: Position in workflow.

children.label: shr.adverse
children.description: The SHR Adverse domain contains definitions for describing adverse events and adverse reactions.

children.label: ActionTaken
children.description: ActionTopic taken as a result of the adverse reaction. May include changing or discontinuing medication, reducing dose, etc.

children.label: AdverseEvent
children.description: Any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, disease, or other medical occurrence with a temporal association with the use of a medical product, procedure or other therapy, or in conjunction with a research study, regardless of causal relationship. EXAMPLE(S): back pain, headache, pulmonary embolism, death. The AdverseEvent may also document a causal relationship to an intervention is at least a reasonable possibility i.e., the relationship cannot be ruled out.

children.label: AdverseEventAttribution

concepts.label: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or ProcedurePerformed (http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1510821)
concepts.display: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or ProcedurePerformed

children.description: A possible cause of an observed adverse event, known or theorized. There can be more than one possible cause.

children.label: AdverseEventGrade
children.description: A coded value specifying the level of injury suffered by the subject for whom the event is reported, using the CTCAE coding system.

children.label: CauseCategory
children.description: Whether the adverse event is attributed to a treatment, course of the disease, unrelated to either, or unknown.

children.label: SeriousAdverseEvent
children.description: Clinical significance of adverse event usually associated with events that pose a threat to a patient's life or functioning. Seriousness of adverse event serves as a primary guide for defining regulatory reporting obligations and changes in medicinal product development and usage.

children.label: ToxicReaction
children.description: A grade 3 or 4 adverse reaction to medication, radiation treatment, or other therapy.

children.label: shr.allergy
children.description: The SHR Allergy domain contains definitions for statements dealing with substance-related risks, including allergies and intolerances.

children.label: AdverseReaction
children.description: An instance of a negative response to the allergy or intolerance.

children.label: AllergenIrritant
children.description: A substance that causes an allergic reaction or irritation.

children.label: AllergyIntolerance
children.description: A finding related to the presence or absence of an individual's risk or sensitivity to a substance or class of substances. A finding can be taken as tantamount to a representation of an allergic condition, allowing it to be tracked over time.

children.label: Manifestation
children.description: A sign or symptom of an underlying condition.

children.label: MostRecentOccurrenceTime
children.description: The time of the last or latest of a series of events.

children.label: NoAllergyToSubstance
children.description: Used to record that a particular substance or class of substances does not pose a known elevated risk to the subject. NoAllergyToSubstance is not an assertion because the value (a code representing a substance) does not carry the complete meaning.

children.label: NoKnownAllergy
children.description: Express no known allergies to broad classes: anything, animals, drugs, foods, or environmental factors. NoKnownAllergy is an assertion because the code, such as 'No known food allergy' carries the complete meaning.

children.label: SubstanceCategory
children.description: Categorization of the risk substance as a food, drug, or environmental agent. For difficult-to-classify substances, one can leave this field empty or choose the most typical category.

children.label: VerificationStatus
children.description: Whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.

children.label: shr.base
children.description: The SHR Base domain contains definitions for basic classes in SHR, including the base Entry and Any. The classes below Any are are Finding, ActionTopic, and Entity.

children.label: Any
children.description: The top level class in the hierarchy

children.label: Attribution
children.description: Who the entry is attributed to, for example, the informer (information source), the recorder, the verifier, the responsible person, etc.

children.label: Author
children.description: The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) the content.

children.label: Content
children.description: A item that can constitute the payload of an Entry, aka an EntryElement.

children.label: Entry
children.description: Metadata attributes that apply to any item represented in the standard health record. An Entry may not belong exclusively to a single person's health record, but could represent an entity that surfaces in multiple records, such as organizations or practitioners. If the entry belongs to a single person's record, then the identity of the person of record must be recorded.

children.label: EntryId
children.description: A persistent, permanent identifier for an entry in a health record, unique within the scope of the health record.

children.label: EntryType
children.description: SHR data element identifier, as a URI. The EntryType array includes the entire 'based on' hierarchy to enable searching for classes of things, for example, searching for all vital signs, or all types of behavioral observations.

children.label: FocalSubject
children.description: For use when FHIR's subject does not allow the desired type of Subject in the Finding.Subject field.

children.label: Informant
children.description: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.

children.label: Language
children.description: A human language, spoken or written.

children.label: LastUpdated
children.description: The most recent date the entry was changed.

children.label: Narrative
children.description: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

children.label: NarrativeQualifier
children.description: Additional information on how the narrative was generated, and the scope of information contained.

children.label: PersonOfRecord
children.description: The person this record belongs to.

children.label: RelatedEncounter
children.description: If content was generated during a patient encounter, related encounter is the encounter where the information was gained.

children.label: SecurityLabel
children.description: A code that connects the entry to a security policy. Security labels can be updated when the resource changes, or whenever the security sub-system chooses to.

children.label: ShrId
children.description: A unique, persistent, permanent identifier for the overall health record belonging to the PersonOfRecord.

children.label: Subject
children.description: The person or thing that this entry relates to, usually the Person of Record. However, not all entries have health information specifically about the patient, but in different contexts, could refer to a fetus, family member (living or dead), device, location, organization, finding, condition, or intervention.

children.label: Tag
children.description: A code used to relate entries to categories or workflows. Applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of an entry.

children.label: shr.behavior
children.description: The SHR Behavior domain contains data definitions related to how the person of record acts, feels, or responds to situations.

children.label: AlcoholBingeFrequency
children.description: How often have you had 6 or more Units if female, or 8 or more if male, on a single occasion in the last year?.

children.label: AlcoholUse
children.description: The history of the subject's use of alcohol.

children.label: BehavioralFinding
children.description: A statement about observable responses, actions, or activities of the subject. Can be used to assert or deny behaviors.

children.label: DietFollowed
children.description: A type of nutritional plan followed by the subject.

children.label: DietNutritionConcern
children.description: An anxiety or worry about the diet or nutritional intake of the subject.

children.label: ExerciseHoursPerWeek
children.description: Hours of moderate or vigorous activity per week.

children.label: FrequencyOfUse
children.description: A description of the frequency of substance use.

children.label: HasSufficientFood
children.description: Frequency that the person of record unable to obtain food to stay hunger.

children.label: HoursSleepPerNight
children.description: Typical hours spent sleeping per night.

children.label: IntravenousDrugUse
children.description: Records whether the subject injects recreational drugs.

children.label: NicotineUse
children.description: Records the history of a subject's use of nicotine.

children.label: ONCSmokingStatus
children.description: Records the subject's use of tobacco.

children.label: OverallSleepQuality
children.description: Self-reported sleep quality.

children.label: PhysicalActivityLevel
children.description: The amount of exercise or other physical activity compared to others of the same age.  See BMC Medical Research Methodology 2012 12:20 1471-2288.

children.label: PhysicalActivityLimitation
children.description: Anything that limits physical activity, including health factors, logistical, monetary, or social restrictions.

children.label: ReadinessToChange
children.description: How motivated the subject is to change the behavior, if the behavior is ongoing, and change would be beneficial.

children.label: ReasonForBehavior
children.description: Why the behavior has taken or is taking place.

children.label: Religion
children.description: The affiliation of the person with a recognized religious group.

children.label: ReligiousCongregation
children.description: A group of place of religious practice.

children.label: ReligiousPracticeStatus
children.description: The extent to which the religious practice is actively followed.

children.label: ReligiousRestriction
children.description: Any restriction on that derives from religion and may impact medical treatment, other than dietary (handled elsewhere).

children.label: SleepQualityCause
children.description: Reason for poor sleep quality.

children.label: SubstanceAbuseTreatment
children.description: The treatment program used to address a substance abuse problem.

children.label: SubstanceUse
children.description: Assertion concerning the past or current use of a substance (alcohol, recreational drugs, illegal drugs, or abuse of prescription medication) that could negatively impact the subject's health.

children.label: TroubleFallingAsleep
children.description: How often the subject has trouble falling asleep.

children.label: TroubleStayingAsleep
children.description: How often the subject has trouble staying asleep.

children.label: ViolentRiskToOthers
children.description: Risk or danger posed by the focal subject to others.

children.label: ViolentRiskToSelf
children.description: Risk or danger posed by the focal subject to his or herself.

children.label: WakeFeelingRested
children.description: How often the subject feels rested when they wake up.

children.label: ActualActivities
children.description: Activites carried out for this goal

children.label: CarePlan
children.description: Describes how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

children.label: CareTeam
children.description: Planned participants in the coordination and delivery of care for a patient or group.

children.label: Goal
children.description: A broad statement about what should be accomplished for or by a patient or other subject. It represents the intended long-term outcome toward which an individual or a group aspires, and toward which, effort is directed, in the form of activities.

children.label: Objective
children.description: Describes the  of an expected or desired achievement that is well-defined, specific, measurable, and derived from one or more goals. The context is inherited from the context of the parent goal, i.e., if the goal is #proposed, then the objective is also #proposed

children.label: PlannedActivities
children.description: Activites planned for this goal

children.label: ResultAchieved
children.description: The actual value or status achieved.

children.label: ResultTargeted
children.description: The desired value or status to be achieved.

children.label: shr.condition
children.description: The SHR Condition domain contains basic definitions used to capture information about problems, concerns, complaints, and disorders.

children.label: Abatement
children.description: The end, remission or resolution.

children.label: AcademicProblem
children.description: A problem with learning or behavior in a learning environment.

children.label: BodyStructureAbsent
children.description: Absence of distinct anatomical or pathological morphological feature or organizational pattern, acquired or innate. Examples include tissue types, tumors, and wounds. The observation has a body site that allows the the structure to be located in the body. The observation identifier allows other observations of the same body structure to be related to QualitativeValueScaleVSthis observation and tracked over time.

children.label: BodyStructurePresent
children.description: Presence of a distinct anatomical or pathological morphological feature or organizational pattern, acquired or innate. Examples include tissue types, tumors, and wounds. Body structures are continuants that allow observations of the same body structure to be related to be tracked over time.

children.label: ClinicalStatus
children.description: A flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition).

children.label: Condition
children.description: A disorder, abnormality, problem, injury, complaint, risk, functionality, concern, illness, disease, ailment, sickness, affliction, upset, difficulty, disorder, symptom, worry, or trouble. A ConditionPresent finding implies the existence of a condition as an entity. 'Condition' is interpreted broadly to cover states of existence - things the patient is or has.

children.label: ConditionAbsent
children.description: A finding that a condition not present in the subject at a certain time.

children.label: Criticality
children.description: The potential clinical harm associated with a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.

children.label: DiseaseProgression
children.description: A finding related to the current trend of a disease. This concept is most often used for chronic and incurable diseases where the status and trendline of the disease is an important determinant of therapy and prognosis. The specific disorder being evaluated must be cited in the AssessmentFocus as a reference to a Condition.

children.label: Injury
children.description: Damage inflicted on the body by an external force.

children.label: MentalHealthCondition
children.description: A condition relating to a person’s psychological and emotional well-being.

children.label: Morphology
children.description: The kind of structure being represented. This can define both normal and abnormal morphologies.

children.label: Onset
children.description: The beginning or first appearance of a mental or physical disorder.

children.label: Preexisting
children.description: If the problem or condition existed before the current episode of care.

children.label: Severity
children.description: Degree of harshness or extent of a symptom, disorder, or condition.

children.label: Stage
children.description: The relative advancement in the course of a disease.

children.label: WhenClinicallyRecognized
children.description: The time at which a condition or condition was first identified in a healthcare context.

children.label: shr.core
children.description: The SHR Core domain contains definitions for a variety of general-purpose elements that are used widely in SHR. These include definitions for coding, expressions of time, quantities, addresses, names, and more.

children.label: Address
children.description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: AddressLine
children.description: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: Age
children.description: How long something has existed in time.

children.label: AgeGroup
children.description: Subgroups of populations based on age.

children.label: AgeRange
children.description: A quantitative range of ages. One of the two ages must be specified.

children.label: Altitude
children.description: Height above sea level or above the earth's surface. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: Annotation
children.description: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.

children.label: Area
children.description: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

children.label: Attachment
children.description: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.

children.label: BinaryData
children.description: The data itself.

children.label: BodyPosition
children.description: The position or physical attitude of the body.

children.label: Category
children.description: A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics

children.label: Certainty
children.description: The degree of confidence in a conclusion or assertion.

children.label: Circumference
children.description: The length of such a boundary line of a figure, area, or object.

children.label: City
children.description: The name of a municipality, city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: ClockDirection
children.description: A direction indicated by an angle relative to 12 o'clock.

children.label: CodeableConcept
children.description: A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept.

children.label: CodeSystem
children.description: A formal terminology system.

children.label: CodeSystemVersion
children.description: The version of the vocabulary being used, if applicable.

children.label: Coding
children.description: Coding of a concept, drawn from a controlled vocabulary. Includes the vocabulary and version, if applicable. May include a display text, and a descriptor expressing the intended interpretation of the code.

children.label: ContactDetail
children.description: Describes an individual and how to reach them.

children.label: ContactPoint
children.description: An electronic means of contacting an organization or individual.

children.label: ContentType
children.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

children.label: CorrectionFactor
children.description: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.

children.label: Count
children.description: The number of items (0 or more), as an integer.

children.label: CountPerInterval
children.description: How many times the event should take place during one recurrence interval, for example, to specify 3-4 times per day, the CountPerInterval should be 3 to 4.

children.label: Country
children.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes.

children.label: CreationTime
children.description: The point in time when the information was recorded in the system of record.

children.label: DailyLifeEvent
children.description: A quotidian landmark, such as rising, mealtime, or bedtime, when an event should take place.

children.label: DayOfWeek
children.description: A day of the week that the pattern should take place.

children.label: Definitional
children.description: An indicator that the item is a description of a thing, not a thing that actually exists. For example, a group of people between ages 30 and 40 with Type II diabetes can be defined, without existing as a set of particular people.

children.label: Denominator
children.description: The divisor of a fraction.

children.label: Depth
children.description: The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

children.label: Details
children.description: An text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization. Details can discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.

children.label: Dimensions
children.description: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.

children.label: DisplayText
children.description: A string meant for reading by a person, for example, accompanying a code.

children.label: Distance
children.description: The measure of space separating two objects or points.

children.label: District
children.description: The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. In the US, a county. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: Duration
children.description: The length of time that something continues.

children.label: DurationRange
children.description: A range of durations.

children.label: EffectiveDate
children.description: The date when something is to take effect.

children.label: EffectiveTimePeriod
children.description: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.

children.label: EmbeddedContent
children.description: Abstract class defining the common metadata of all types of encapsulated data, such as images.

children.label: EventDuration
children.description: The length of the recurring event.

children.label: FamilyName
children.description: The portion of a person's name that reflects the genealogy of the person. In western cultures, this is the 'last' name. In eastern cultures, the family name appears before the person's given name(s). In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father. (Source: HL7 V3).

children.label: Formalism
children.description: The system of formal syntax or interpretation associated with parsable content.

children.label: Frequency
children.description: How many occurrences of an event per unit of time.

children.label: GeneralizedAge
children.description: Qualitative or quantitative, exact or inexact description of age.

children.label: GeneralizedDateTime
children.description: A point in time, specified qualitatively or quantitatively.

children.label: GeneralizedDuration
children.description: The duration of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively.

children.label: GeneralizedFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively.

children.label: GeneralizedLikelihood
children.description: Quantitative or qualitative measure of likelihood.

children.label: GeneralizedTemporalContext
children.description: A generalized indicator of a dateTime or an age when an event happened.

children.label: GeopoliticalLocation
children.description: The countries of the world and major geopolitical subregions, such as US states.

children.label: Geoposition
children.description: The location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).

children.label: GestationalAge
children.description: The age of the embryo or fetus. This may be assessed by medical history, physical examination, early immunologic pregnancy tests, radiography, ultrasonography, and amniotic fluid analysis.

children.label: GestationalTemporalContext
children.description: A named gestational time period, or a gestational age.

children.label: GestationalTimePeriod
children.description: A time relative to a pregnancy or childbirth event.

children.label: GivenName
children.description: A set of names given to a person at birth, but not including the family name. In western cultures, this property would contain the 'first' and 'middle' names. Note that in some cultures, the given name is placed after the family name. Also note this property contains multiple elements, so it can handle those situations where a person has more than one 'middle' name. (Source: HL7 V3).

children.label: Hash
children.description: A hash code of the data (sha-1, base64ed)

children.label: HumanName
children.description: A name used by a human being, written as it would be typically expressed. May include a breakdown of the various elements of the name (family name, given name, etc.).

children.label: HumanNamePrefix
children.description: Contains a set of honorific terms that typically appear before a person's name, for example Mr., Mrs., Dr., etc. Prefixes have a strong association to the immediately following name part. (Source: HL7 V3).

children.label: HumanNameSuffix
children.description: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

children.label: Identifier
children.description: A unique string that identifies a specific person or thing.

children.label: IntegerQuantity
children.description: A Quantity that is an integer.

children.label: Latitude
children.description: The angular distance north or south between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: Length
children.description: The measurement or linear extent of something from end to end; the greatest dimensions of a body.

children.label: LifeEventOffset
children.description: A time in minutes before or after a given life event, for example, 30 minutes before a meal. Whether this means before or after is carried by the life event code.

children.label: Likelihood
children.description: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event, as a percentage.

children.label: Location
children.description: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

children.label: Longitude
children.description: An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: LowerBound
children.description: The lower limit on a range

children.label: LowerLimit
children.description: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'L' (lower than detection limit).

children.label: MaxCount
children.description: Upper bound on a count.

children.label: MillisecondsBetweenSamples
children.description: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.

children.label: MinCount
children.description: Lower bound on a count.

children.label: Money
children.description: Representation of an amount of currency or monetary value.

children.label: NumberOfRepeats
children.description: How many times the action should be repeated.

children.label: Numerator
children.description: The dividend of a fraction.

children.label: OccurrenceDuration
children.description: The length of time in which something happens.

children.label: OccurrencePeriod
children.description: The point in time or span of time in which something happens.

children.label: OccurrenceTime
children.description: The point in time in which something happens.

children.label: OccurrenceTimeOrPeriod
children.description: The point in time or span of time in which something happens.

children.label: OnBehalfOf
children.description: The party represented by the actual participant.

children.label: OrganizationalIdentifier
children.description: A code identifying a specific organization. The NPI should be provided, if available. Other business identifiers, such employer tax ID, or MVX code for vaccine manufacturers, should also be provided.

children.label: Origin
children.description: The base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

children.label: ParsableContent
children.description: A string that follows a formal syntax and can be analyzed and broken into meaningful parts.

children.label: Percentage
children.description: A percentage value where 100.0 represents 100%.

children.label: PlainText
children.description: A text written in a human language.

children.label: PostalCode
children.description: A sequence of letters and digits used as part of a postal address, often designating a geographic region

children.label: Priority
children.description: An indication of the importance of an action.

children.label: Qount
children.description: The whole number of items, as a unit-bearing quantity.

children.label: QualitativeDateTime
children.description: A point in time, described qualitatively.

children.label: QualitativeFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, described qualitatively.

children.label: QualitativeLikelihood
children.description: A qualitative (subjective) likelihood.

children.label: Quantity
children.description: A quantity with units, whose value may be bounded from above or below, as defined in FHIR

children.label: Range
children.description: An interval defined by a quantitative upper and/or lower bound. One of the two bounds must be specified, and the lower bound must be less than the upper bound. When Quantities are specified, the units of measure must be the same.

children.label: Ratio
children.description: A unit of measurement for the quotient of the amount of one entity to another.

children.label: Reason
children.description: The justification for an action or non-action, conclusion, opinion, etc.

children.label: ReceivedTime
children.description: Time received by accepting facility or unit.

children.label: RecurrenceInterval
children.description: The period of time after which the pattern repeats, for example, each day. To specify an event should take place every other Monday, the recurrence interval should be two weeks, and DayOfWeek should be Monday.

children.label: RecurrencePattern
children.description: A set of rules that describe when a recurring event is scheduled.

children.label: RecurrenceRange
children.description: The start and end of the overall recurrence pattern in terms of dates/times or in terms of number of repeats. Could also be an event, such as when all doses are taken.

children.label: ResourceLocation
children.description: URI where data can be found.

children.label: ResourceSize
children.description: Number of bytes of content in the resource (if url provided)

children.label: SampledData
children.description: Data that comes from a series of measurements taken by a device, which may have upper and lower limits. The data type also supports more than one dimension in the data.

children.label: SemiquantDuration
children.description: The duration of an event, described semi-quantitatively.

children.label: SemiquantFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, described semi-quantitatively.

children.label: Setting
children.description: Description of the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.

children.label: Signatory
children.description: The party signing.

children.label: Signature
children.description: A digital Signature - XML DigSig, JWT, Graphical image of signature, etc.

children.label: SimpleQuantity
children.description: A quantity where the comparator is not used, as defined in FHIR

children.label: State
children.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: Statistic
children.description: A quantity that represents a statistic, e.g. maximum, minimum, mean, median, etc.

children.label: StatisticType
children.description: The type of statistic that is represented by the value.

children.label: TelecomNumberOrAddress
children.description: A user name or other identifier on a telecommunication network, such as a telephone number (including country code and extension, if necessary), email address, or SkypeID.

children.label: TimeOfDay
children.description: Time of day the event should take place on the designated day(s). TimeOfDay should only be specified if the RecurrenceInterval and/or DayOfWeek establishes the day when the event should take place.

children.label: TimePeriod
children.description: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year. If the start element is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end element is missing, it means that the period is ongoing, or the start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at the specified time. The end value includes any matching date/time. For example, the period 2011-05-23 to 2011-05-27 includes all the times from the start of the 23rd May through to the end of the 27th of May.

children.label: TimePeriodEnd
children.description: The time at which something is to end or did end. Boundary is considered inclusive.

children.label: TimePeriodStart
children.description: The time at which something is to take effect, start, or did start. Boundary is considered inclusive.

children.label: Timing
children.description: A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing offers a choice of multiple OccurrenceTime (used is used to specify specific times), or recurrence patterns.

children.label: TimingCode
children.description: A code for the timing schedule. Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

children.label: Title
children.description: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

children.label: UnitedStatesAddress
children.description: An address for a place in the USA, conforming to US mail postal conventions. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

children.label: UnitedStatesState
children.description: A state or territory in the USA expressed by 2-letter US Postal code.

children.label: Units
children.description: Code for the unit of measure of the quantity.

children.label: UpperBound
children.description: The upper limit on a quantitative value.

children.label: UpperLimit
children.description: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value 'U' (higher than detection limit).

children.label: Version
children.description: A string identifying the particular of form of something (such as a code system or software product) that is different in some way from another form of the same thing.

children.label: Volume
children.description: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

children.label: Width
children.description: The measurement or extent of something from side to side.

children.label: shr.device
children.description: The SHR Device domain contains definitions relating to devices used to treat the person of record, either in measurements and observations, durable medical equipment used by the patient, and device implants.

children.label: Device
children.description: A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.

children.label: DeviceNotUsed
children.description: A record of a device not used by a patient, for example, no stent implanted.

children.label: DeviceTopic
children.description: A medical device or implanted device of a patient, independent of context of being recommended, used, or not used. Device use can be reported, directly observed, or inferred from clinical events associated with orders, prescriptions written, and other patient-reported information.

children.label: DeviceUdi
children.description: Unique Device Identifier (UDI) Barcode string number for a device, assigned by the organization using the device.

children.label: DeviceUsed
children.description: A record of the use of a device by a patient.

children.label: Implanted
children.description: Whether this device is implanted in the body.

children.label: VendorModelNumber
children.description: The model number of the device, assigned by the manufacturer or vendor.

children.label: shr.encounter
children.description: The SHR Encounter domain contains definitions that capture interactions between the person of record and healthcare providers, including inpatient, ambulatory care, and telecare.

children.label: EncounterTopic
children.description: A description of an interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient, independent of the context of requested, planned, performed, etc.

children.label: PaymentSource
children.description: The source of payment for the current encounter.

children.label: ReferralDate
children.description: The date when the provider received a referral for service. A referral includes an oral, written, faxed or electronic request for services made by the client or on the client's behalf.

children.label: ReferralSourceType
children.description: The type of person or entity that instigated the encounter.

children.label: ServiceGiven
children.description: Indicates a medical service provided.

children.label: ServiceProvider
children.description: The organization that provided the services rendered during this encounter.

children.label: TreatmentCooperation
children.description: Whether the patient is undergoing treatment voluntarily, or under a legal order.

children.label: shr.entity
children.description: The SHR Entity domain contains definitions for objects, people and organizations that are involved with the person of record, in some capacity. Entities are things that have separate and distinct existence and objective or conceptual reality. Includes information items, physical objects, health states, and parties.

children.label: AccessionIdentifier
children.description: Identifier assigned by the lab

children.label: AccessTime
children.description: Point in time when data was accessed.

children.label: ActiveFlag
children.description: If the ActiveFlag is false, it indicates the record or item is no longer to be used and should generally be hidden for the user in the UI.

children.label: ActiveFlagAsaCodeableConcept
children.description: If the ActiveFlag is false, it indicates the record or item is no longer to be used and should generally be hidden for the user in the UI.

children.label: Additive
children.description: Additive associated with container.

children.label: AdministrativeGender
children.description: A gender classification used for administrative purposes. Administrative gender is not necessarily the same as a biological description or a gender identity. This attribute does not include terms related to clinical gender.

children.label: Affiliation
children.description: Membership, association, or connection to an organization.

children.label: AgeAtDeath
children.description: The age, age range, or age group when the cessation of life happens.

children.label: AnonymizedFlag
children.description: Flag indicating if personally identifiable information has been withheld or disguised.

children.label: BirthSex
children.description: Administrative sex assigned at birth and recorded on birth certificate.

children.label: BodySite
children.description: A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.

children.label: BodySiteMarker
children.description: A marker surgically placed at the site, often during a biopsy procedure, to pinpoint the location. The marker is typically a metal clip or radioactive seed.

children.label: BodySiteOrCode
children.description: A body site entity or a body site code.

children.label: Brand
children.description: If the product is branded, and if so, the brand name of a product.

children.label: BrandName
children.description: The marketing name for a brand name product

children.label: Capacity
children.description: Container volume or size.

children.label: CountryOfIssue
children.description: A country acting as an assuing authority for a document.

children.label: DateOfBirth
children.description: A date of birth or approximate year or period (year or date range), if estimated.

children.label: DateOfDeath
children.description: The calendar date of subject's death.

children.label: Deceased
children.description: An indication that the person is no longer living, given by a date, time of death, or a boolean value which, when true, indicates the person is deceased.

children.label: Directionality
children.description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.

children.label: DoseForm
children.description: The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) are physically presented.

children.label: DriversLicenseNumber
children.description: Identifying information from a drivers license.

children.label: Entity
children.description: Something that has separate and distinct existence and objective or conceptual reality. Includes information items, physical objects, health states, and parties.

children.label: Ethnicity
children.description: Indicator of Hispanic or Latino origin.

children.label: EthnicityDetail
children.description: Additional description of ethnicity.

children.label: ExcludeFlag
children.description: If true, exclude the subjects that match the criterion.

children.label: ExpirationDate
children.description: When the medication will expire.

children.label: ExternalHealthRecord
children.description: A health record other than the current health record; may have been used to help populate the current record.

children.label: Facility
children.description: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.

children.label: FacilityName
children.description: The DBA (doing business as) or most commonly-used name for a facility.

children.label: FathersName
children.description: The name of the father as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the subject; most likely the name of the father at the time of birth of the subject.

children.label: FictionalPersonFlag
children.description: Flag indicating if this record represents a fictional (synthetic, not real) person.

children.label: Group
children.description: A set of entities (personnel, material, or places) to be considered together. May be a pool of like-type resources, a team, or combination of personnel, material and places.

children.label: HandlingRisk
children.description: Cautions on the handling of this specimen.

children.label: Headshot
children.description: A photograph showing a person's face.

children.label: InformationItem
children.description: A non-material thing that contains information relevant to health care, such as an image, consent form, or report.

children.label: Ingredient
children.description: Specifies an material component in a non-medication substance.

children.label: IngredientAmount
children.description: The amount of an ingredient in a mixture, as a ratio. For example, 250 mg per tablet is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

children.label: IsActiveIngredient
children.description: True if the ingredient is an active ingredient in the medication.

children.label: Issuer
children.description: An organization who issues a qualification, identifier, or license.

children.label: LanguageQualifier
children.description: Additional information about a person's use of language.

children.label: LanguageUsed
children.description: Language used for communication by a human, either the subject of record, parent, or other involved person.

children.label: Laterality
children.description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.

children.label: LotNumber
children.description: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch.

children.label: ManagingOrganization
children.description: The organization that manages the operation of an activity, facility, or service provision.

children.label: Manufacturer
children.description: The organization producing the product.

children.label: MaritalStatus
children.description: The most recent marital status of a person.

children.label: MedicalInterpreterNeeded
children.description: Whether the subject requires an interpreter to communicate with an English-speaking provider.

children.label: Medication
children.description: A type of prescription drug or over-the-counter drug that is used to prevent, treat, or relieve symptoms of a disease or abnormal condition, but excluding vaccines.

children.label: MedicationIngredient
children.description: Specifies an material component in a medication.

children.label: MedicationOrCode
children.description: A medication entity or a medication code.

children.label: MembershipCriterion
children.description: An inclusion or exclusion criterion as part of defining a cohort. If the criterion is an unary, then ObservationCode must be SCT#385432009 (not applicable)

children.label: MobileFacility
children.description: A facility that moves from place to place, such as Meals-On-Wheels.

children.label: MothersMaidenName
children.description: The name of the mother as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the subject. This is most likely the name prior to marriage of the mother (aka the maiden name).

children.label: MultipleBirth
children.description: Indication if the person was part of a multiple birth event.

children.label: MultipleBirthOrder
children.description: Order of birth of the person in multiple birth event (if part of multiple birth).

children.label: NationalProviderIdentifier
children.description: A unique 10-digit number to allow US healthcare providers to identify themselves in a standard way throughout the healthcare industry.

children.label: Object
children.description: A material thing that can be seen and touched. An object can be found in a specific location.

children.label: Organization
children.description: A social or legal structure formed by human beings.

children.label: OrganizationAlias
children.description: A list of alternate names that the organization is known as, or was known as in the past.

children.label: OrganizationIdentifier
children.description: An identifier of the organization. An NPI preferred, tax id is allowed, and a local id is allowed in addition to ‘authoritative’ identifier

children.label: OrganizationName
children.description: The name of the organization.

children.label: OverTheCounter
children.description: True if the medication is available to consumers without a prescription.

children.label: Package
children.description: The kind of container the medication comes in.

children.label: PartOf
children.description: The larger entity that this is a portion of.

children.label: Party
children.description: A person, organization, or object that can participate in a healthcare activity.

children.label: PassportNumber
children.description: Credential indicating citizenship.

children.label: Patient
children.description: A person in the role of a patient, including extended demographic information about the subject of this health record.

children.label: Person
children.description: A person relevant to the health or social situation of the subject (including the person of record him or herself).

children.label: PlaceOfBirth
children.description: The location of a birth event. There may be multiple entries, but a person has only one place of birth.

children.label: PortionTotality
children.description: Further detail of the anatomical location or specimen detailing whether it includes the entire entity or only a part or portion.

children.label: Practitioner
children.description: A person who practices a healing art.

children.label: Purpose
children.description: Describes how the item is (or was) used or applied.

children.label: Qualification
children.description: A right to practice medicine obtained by training and certification.

children.label: Race
children.description: Subjective association of a person with a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, place of family origin, nationality, tribe, or other inherited background.

children.label: RaceDetail
children.description: Additional description of race or heritage.

children.label: RelatedPerson
children.description: A person in a role defined in relationship to a patient

children.label: RelationshipType
children.description: The relationship of the subject to another person in the same extended family or extended family. May or may not be a blood relative.

children.label: Role
children.description: Abstract parent class for human parties, such as practitioners, patients, research subjects, and related persons. Role can also represent an object playing a specific role, such as a room playing the role of operating theater.

children.label: SequenceNumber
children.description: The sequence number for this specimen in a collection of specimens.

children.label: SocialSecurityNumber
children.description: A US social security number (SSN).

children.label: SourceSpecimen
children.description: Identifier for the source specimen from which this specimen was derived.

children.label: SpecialHandling
children.description: Information about the proper handling of the specimen.

children.label: Specimen
children.description: Sample for analysis

children.label: SpecimenContainer
children.description: Direct container of specimen (tube/slide, etc.)

children.label: SpecimenQuantity
children.description: Quantity of specimen within container.

children.label: SpecimenTreatment
children.description: Treatment performed on the specimen.

children.label: SpecimenType
children.description: Kind of material that forms the specimen

children.label: SpokenLanguageProficiency
children.description: Accuracy and fluency in spoken communication in a language.

children.label: StateOfIssue
children.description: A state or country acting as an assuing authority for a document.

children.label: Substance
children.description: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

children.label: SubstanceOrCode
children.description: A substance entity or a substance code.

children.label: Type
children.description: The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.

children.label: WrittenLanguageProficiency
children.description: Accuracy and fluency of reading and writing in a language.

children.label: shr.environment
children.description: The SHR Environment domain contains definitions related to surroundings experienced by the person of record, including both the physical and sociological environments.

children.label: AnimalExposure
children.description: The type of animals or pets the subject is exposed to.

children.label: AnnualIncome
children.description: The amount of earnings made by a family unit in one year, estimated or self-reported.

children.label: CanAffordChildCare
children.description: How often can the subject afford child care?

children.label: CanAffordClothing
children.description: How often can the subject afford clothing?

children.label: CanAffordDentalCare
children.description: How often can the subject afford dental care?

children.label: CanAffordFood
children.description: How often can the subject afford food?

children.label: CanAffordHousing
children.description: How often can the subject afford housing?

children.label: CanAffordMedication
children.description: How often can the subject afford medications?

children.label: CanAffordTransportation
children.description: How often can the subject afford transportation?

children.label: CanAffordUtilities
children.description: How often can the subject afford utilities?

children.label: Coinhabitant
children.description: A person living with the subject.

children.label: DomesticViolence
children.description: Whether the subject experiences domestic violence.

children.label: EmotionalSafety
children.description: Whether the subject feels physically safe in the subject's home environment.

children.label: ExposureMethod
children.description: How the exposure occurred, e.g. cutaneous contact, injection, ingestion, sexual contact, inhalation.

children.label: ExposureReason
children.description: Why the exposure occurred.

children.label: ExposureRoute
children.description: The way a substance enters an organism after contact, particularly, the route of drug administration.

children.label: ExposureSourceOrVector
children.description: Where the substance originated. Vectors include animals (e.g., tick, mosquito, cats, livestock) capable of transmitting an infectious agent among vertebrates. Sources could include food, contaminated drinking water, air, radon gas in the home, etc.

children.label: ExposureToAgent
children.description: A finding about exposure to a substance, type of substance, or disease vector potentially affecting health, including blood products, pets, recreational drugs, sexual transmitted diseases, foods, toxins, pathogens, noise, radiation, pollutants, or prenatal exposures to teratogens. Can be used to deny such exposures via the NegationFlag.

children.label: FinancialSituation
children.description: Measures of the ability of the subject to obtain and pay for the necessities of life.

children.label: HomeEnvironmentRisk
children.description: A risk experienced in the home environment.

children.label: HouseholdSituation
children.description: Information about the makeup of the household of the subject.

children.label: HouseholdSize
children.description: The number of people living together with mutual financial dependency. Besides the subject, the household size may include spouse or partner, dependent children including adopted and foster children, dependent parents, dependent siblings and other relatives, but not roommates, ex-spouses, non-dependent children, and unborn children. If the subject lives alone, the household size is 1.

children.label: HousingSecurity
children.description: Whether the subject is at-risk of losing their housing or in a stable housing situation.

children.label: IncomeSource
children.description: Where the household income comes from.

children.label: IncomeStability
children.description: Whether the subject regards his or her source of income as dependable.

children.label: NonCashBenefit
children.description: Government benefits received by the focal subject, other than cash benefits.

children.label: NumberOfDependents
children.description: The number of dependents supported by the subject.

children.label: PhysicalSafety
children.description: How often the subject feels physically safe in the subject's home environment.

children.label: SocialEnvironment
children.description: Factors affecting the health of the subject in their daily living environment.

children.label: TransportationAvailability
children.description: Whether the subject has reliable transportation to bring him or her to medical appointments and to get medications.

children.label: shr.familyhistory
children.description: The SHR Family History domain contains definitions related to the life, health, and genetics of persons related to the person of record.

children.label: FamilyMemberCondition
children.description: A condition of a person related to the person of record.

children.label: FamilyMemberConditionAbsent
children.description: A condition of a person related to the person of record.

children.label: shr.financial
children.description: The SHR Demographics domain contains definitions that describe basic characteristics of the person of record, such as name, address, and date of birth. Elements in the demographics domains are used for unique identification and patient matching.

children.label: Coverage
children.description: Health insurance coverage available (even if not used for payment for a given encounter).

children.label: InsuranceMemberId
children.description: Patient identifier at a healthcare provider, insurer, or other related organization.

children.label: shr.finding
children.description: The SHR Finding domain contains basic definitions used to capture subjective and objective information about the subject. Things observed about the subject can include demographic facts, history, subjective and objective observations, assessments, and judgments, excluding actual or potential interventions, and range from simple answered questions to vital signs and laboratory results.

children.label: ApplicableAgeRange
children.description: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

children.label: ApplicableSubpopulation
children.description: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.

children.label: Assertion
children.description: A unary observation, also known as an assertion, is an observation that takes the form of a single code, without an explicit question or property. Examples include reported symptoms such as 'chest pain' and simple reports such as 'bed in low position'. Assertions may be negated using the NegationFlag; if true, the assertion is taken as false. The question code is defaulted to 'assertion' since an assertion has no explicit question. Assertions may include a body site.

children.label: ChangeFlag
children.description: Indicator of significant change (delta) from the last or previous measurement.

children.label: ClinicallyRelevantTime
children.description: The time or time period that the finding addresses. The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered or when a test is carried out, but for example, when a specimen was collected, or the time period referred to by the question. Use a TimePeriod for a measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).

children.label: Components
children.description: Components are parts of the parent observation. Component observations share the same attributes (such as Specimen) as the primary observation and are not separable. However, the reference range may be different for each component observation.

children.label: Evidence
children.description: A symptom, observation, or other item, for example, a radiology report, that serves as evidence for the current assessment.

children.label: Finding
children.description: Base class for assertions and observations. The subject of a finding can be the entire patient, or an entity such as a location body structure, intervention, or condition. Things observed about the subject can include social and behavioral factors, subjective and objective observations, and assessments.

children.label: FindingMethod
children.description: The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical or assessment vehicle.

children.label: FindingStatus
children.description: Indicates whether the finding is preliminary, amended, final, etc..

children.label: Interpretation
children.description: A clinical interpretation of a finding.

children.label: Members
children.description: Members represent the elements of a group of a related observations. Examples are the measurements that compose a complete blood count (CBC), or the elements of a pathology report. Each member is an independent observation, but the grouping reflects a composite lab order, shared specimen, or a single report author.

children.label: NegationFlag
children.description: A flag that indicates the meaning to be conveyed is the logical opposite of the current assertion. The assertion is negated only when the NegationIndicator is true. If absent or false, the assertion is not negated.

children.label: Observation
children.description: Parent class for subjective or objective findings about a subject. An observation includes direct results of seeing, measuring, or evaluating. The method of observing can vary widely, and include measurement, direct questioning, physical examination, laboratory tests, and imaging procedures. Patient-generated data are also considered observations.

children.label: ObservationCode
children.description: A code that represents what the finding concerns, for example, the subject's height, blood pressure, disease status, wound dimensions, diabetes risk, etc. Although named ObservationCode, in different contexts the same attribute might be more naturally referred to as a property, observable, or test code. In assertions (observations without an explicit question), the observation code is defaulted to a value representing 'assertion'.

children.label: ObservationComponent
children.description: A simplified, non-separable observation consisting of a observation code, value (or value absent reason), reference range, and interpretation. The subject of the observation component is the same as in the parent observation.

children.label: ObservationQualifier
children.description: A description of the conditions or context of an observation, for example, under sedation, fasting or post-exercise. Body position and body site are also qualifiers, but handled separately. A qualifier cannot modify the measurement type; for example, a fasting blood sugar is still a blood sugar.

children.label: Panel
children.description: A grouped set of related findings, frequently captured at the same time. An example is a complete blood count (CBC), with separate observations for hemoglobin, hematocrit, etc. Typically the Category and Reason are not given for individual findings that are part of the panel, but rather given at the level of the panel itself. The panel and all its sub-observations share the same metadata (provenance).

children.label: QuestionAnswer
children.description: A question-answer or property-value pair, regarding a subject (aka an object-attribute-value triple). A QuestionAnswer is a simplified observation that does not involve a specimen, device, or reference range.

children.label: QuestionAnswerPanel
children.description: A panel whose members are QuestionAnswer.

children.label: ReferenceRange
children.description: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.

children.label: RelatedFinding
children.description: Findings associated with this item.

children.label: ValueAbsentReason
children.description: Provides a reason why the value of the observation is missing, if it is expected (some observations are not expected to have a value).

children.label: shr.immunization
children.description: The SHR Immunization domain contains definitions related to vaccinations, whether they are received, recommended, missing, or refused.

children.label: ImmunizationGiven
children.description: A vaccination that was administered to the subject.

children.label: ImmunizationNotGiven
children.description: An immunization that was not given to the subject.

children.label: ImmunizationRequested
children.description: An immunization that is proposed or planned for the subject.

children.label: ImmunizationRequestedAgainst
children.description: An immunization that is specifically not recommended, perhaps contraindicated for the individual.

children.label: ImmunizationTopic
children.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

children.label: Vaccine
children.description: A specific type or manufactured instance of a vaccine, a prophylactic or therapeutic preparation given to produce immune response to pathogenic organisms or substances.

children.label: shr.lifehistory
children.description: The SHR Lifehistory domain contains definitions related to the course of events in the life of the person of record that might impact health, health risks, or future treatment.

children.label: CongenitalAbnormality
children.description: Any abnormality, genetic, anatomical, biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period. Includes malformations, deformations, and chromosomal abnormalities.

children.label: EducationalAttainment
children.description: Educational attainment or level of education of individuals.

children.label: Employment
children.description: Engagement in an activity or service for profit, wages, salary, or as a service to others.

children.label: EmploymentStatus
children.description: Condition of employment including full- or part-time, temporary or permanent, and unemployment.

children.label: MilitaryBranch
children.description: The branch of the US military that the subject has served.

children.label: MilitaryService
children.description: History of service in the US military.

children.label: MilitaryServiceDischargeStatus
children.description: How the subject was formally discharged from the US Military.

children.label: MilitaryServiceEra
children.description: The time period of US military service.

children.label: MilitaryStatus
children.description: The current connection to the US military.

children.label: Occupation
children.description: The principal activity that a person does to earn money, specifying the job performed by the subject, for example, accountant, programmer analyst, patient care associate, staff nurse, etc.

children.label: PrenatalExposure
children.description: Fetal contact with a dangerous substance via the mother.

children.label: ServiceConnectedDisability
children.description: Percentage disability resulting from US Military Service.

children.label: Travel
children.description: Trip to a foreign country or an area, particularly when a health risk is involved.

children.label: shr.medication
children.description: The SHR Medication domain contains definitions related to medications taken, or not taken, by the person of record, both currently and in the past.

children.label: AdditionalDoseInstruction
children.description: Supplemental instructions - e.g. 'with meals'.

children.label: Adherence
children.description: The degree (frequency) that the stated treatment plan, prescription, or protocol was followed. A statement of the ability and cooperation of the patient in taking medicine or supplement as recommended or prescribed. This includes correct timing, dosage, and frequency.

children.label: AdministrationBodySite
children.description: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is applied.

children.label: AdministrationMethod
children.description: Technique for administering medication.

children.label: AmountOfMedication
children.description: A standardized measure or discrete amount of medication serving as a reference for dosing or strength, for example, 1 tablet.

children.label: AmountPerDose
children.description: The amount of medication taken at each dose, as a quantity or range.

children.label: AsNeededIndicator
children.description: Indicates the pre-condition under which the drug or intervention should be used.

children.label: Dosage
children.description: The dosage of the medication as prescribed. Do not include if dosage was not known.

children.label: DoseInstructionsText
children.description: The directions (signetur) on the drug prescription or dispensing record.

children.label: MaximumDosePerTimePeriod
children.description: The maximum amount of a medication to be taken in a given period of time (e.g., no more than x in any 24-hour period)

children.label: MedicationAfterChange
children.description: The medication taken, prior to the change.

children.label: MedicationBeforeChange
children.description: The medication taken, prior to the change.

children.label: MedicationChangeTopic
children.description: Description of a modification or change of a medication or dosage.

children.label: MedicationDispensed
children.description: Indicates that a medication product has been dispensed for a named person/patient. This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication. The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.

children.label: MedicationDispenseTopic
children.description: The action of ordering and deliving a medication to the party responsible for administering the medication.

children.label: MedicationNotDispensed
children.description: Indicates that a medication product has NOT been dispensed for a named person/patient. This may be a result of the timing out of an order or detection of pharmacist of duplicate prescription or other reason.

children.label: MedicationNotRequested
children.description: A record of a medication NOT prescribed. Recorded only when deviating from the normal expectation, care plan, or standard of care.

children.label: MedicationNotUsed
children.description: A record of a medication NOT used. Although usually not required, a medication not used is sometimes reported when deviating from normal expectation or care plan.

children.label: MedicationRequested
children.description: An order for a medication to be dispensed and instructions for use.

children.label: MedicationTopic
children.description: A course or dose of medication for a patient, independent of context of being recommended, used, or not used. Medication use can be reported, directly observed, or inferred from clinical events associated with orders, prescriptions written, pharmacy dispensings, procedural administrations, and other patient-reported information.

children.label: MedicationUsed
children.description: A record of the use of a medication.

children.label: NumberOfRefillsAllowed
children.description: The maximum number of times the dispense can be repeated. For medication dispense, this integer does NOT include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus 3 repeats, then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.

children.label: QuantityPerDispense
children.description: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

children.label: RouteIntoBody
children.description: The way a substance enters an organism after contact, particularly, the route of drug administration.

children.label: SupplyDuration
children.description: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

children.label: TimingOfDoses
children.description: When doses of medication should be administered.

children.label: shr.oncology
children.description: SHR implementation of ASCO requirements.

children.label: BRCA1Variant
children.description: Whether the patient has a mutation in the BRCA1 gene.

children.label: BRCA2Variant
children.description: Whether the patient has a mutation in the BRCA2 gene.

children.label: BreastCancer
children.description: Finding or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.

children.label: BreastCancerGeneticAnalysis
children.description: The status of genes known or suspected to play a role in breast cancer risk, for example, the tumor suppressor genes, BRCA1 and BRCA2.

children.label: BreastCancerReceptorStatus
children.description: Immunohistochemistry (IHC) assessment for estrogen receptor (ER) and progesterone receptor (PR) as well as IHC or in situ hybridization (ISH) determination of human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) status

children.label: CancerGrowthPotential
children.description: Information relating to rate of cell growth or proportion of cancer cells within the tumor that are growing and dividing to form new cancer cells.

children.label: Cellularity
children.description: Percentage of cells in a sample that are cancerous

children.label: DegreeOfLymphaticInvolvement
children.description: Assessment of how much cancer is in a lymph node.

children.label: EstrogenReceptorStatus
children.description: Estrogen receptor alpha is the predominant estrogen receptor expressed in breast tissue and is overexpressed in around 50% of breast carcinomas. ER status (positive=present or overexpressed; negative=absent) is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options.

children.label: GeneticVariant
children.description: Whether a subject carries a mutation in a particular gene.

children.label: HistologicGrade
children.description: The Elston Grade/Nottingham Score, representative of the aggressive potential of the tumor. Well differentiated (Grade 1) look similar to normal cells and are usually slow growing, while poorly differentiated cells (Grade 3) look very different than normal and are fast-growing.

children.label: HumanEpiduralGrowthFactorReceptor2Status
children.description: HER2 is a member of the human epidermal growth factor receptor family of proteins and is encoded by the ERBB2 oncogene. HER2 is overexpressed in 20-30% of breast tumors,10 and is associated with an aggressive clinical course and poor prognosis. HER2 status (positive=present or overexpressed; negative=absent) is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options.

children.label: Ki-67LabelingIndex
children.description: Ki-67 is a protein phosphatase whose expression is strongly associated with cell proliferation and encoded by the MKI67 gene. The Ki67 labeling index is the fraction of Ki-67-positive cells to total cells in a tumor specimen and may be useful for determining prognosis with respect to survival and disease recurrence.
