The more positive cells there are, the more quickly they are dividing and forming new cells.	ReferenceRange: Low <10, Intermediate 10-20, >20 High

children.label: LargestLymphNodeSize
children.description: The largest dimension of the largest lymph node invaded by cancer cells.

children.label: LymphaticInvolvement
children.description: Description of lymph nodes contain cancer cells.

children.label: M-Stage
children.description: Part of the TNM classification system representing metastases.  The system is used to describe the spread of cancer to other parts of the body. See Table 144 in HL7 CDA® R2 Implementation Guide: Clinical Oncology Treatment Plan and Summary, Release 1 - US Realm

children.label: MitoticCountScore
children.description: How fast the tumor cells are growing and dividing, determined from the number of mitotic cells present. Scored 1 to 3, with 3 being the most mitotic cells.

children.label: N-Stage
children.description: The presence of metastases in regional lymph nodes. TNM node category for staging derived from the American Joint Committee on Cancer. See Table 147 in HL7 CDA® R2 Implementation Guide: Clinical Oncology Treatment Plan and Summary, Release 1 - US Realm

children.label: NuclearPleomorphismScore
children.description: How large and varied the nuclei of the tumor cells are. Scored 1 to 3, with 3 being the most pleomorphism.

children.label: NumberOfLymphNodesInvolved
children.description: A count of lymph nodes invaded by cancer cells of those examined.

children.label: PercentageInSituCarcinoma
children.description: The percentage of the cancer that is in situ, as opposed to invading other tissues.

children.label: ProgesteroneReceptorStatus
children.description: Progesterone receptor is expressed in 65% of breast carcinomas. PR status (positive=present or overexpressed; negative=absent) is a factor in determining prognosis and treatment options.

children.label: ReceptorAllredTotalScore
children.description: Part of the Allred scoring, the total of proportion and intensity scores, from 0 to 8.

children.label: ReceptorIntensityScore
children.description: Part of the Allred scoring, based on the intensity of that staining, on a scale of 0 to 3.

children.label: ReceptorPositivityPercentage
children.description: The percentage of cells that test (stain) positive for the presence of a receptor.

children.label: ReceptorProportionScore
children.description: Part of Allred scoring, based on the percentage of cells that stain for a receptor, on a scale of 0 to 5.

children.label: ReceptorStatus
children.description: Refers to the presence or absence of specific receptor molecules on the surface of a cells in a specimen.

children.label: Refseq
children.description: The Reference Sequence (RefSeq) collection provides a comprehensive, integrated, non-redundant, well-annotated set of sequences, including genomic DNA, transcripts, and proteins. RefSeq sequences form a foundation for medical, functional, and diversity studies. They provide a stable reference for genome annotation, gene identification and characterization, mutation and polymorphism analysis (especially RefSeqGene records), expression studies, and comparative analyses.

children.label: S-PhaseFraction
children.description: An expression of the number of mitoses found in a stated number of cells. The S-phase fraction number tells you what percentage of cells in the tissue sample are in the process of copying their genetic information (DNA). This S-phase, short for synthesis phase, happens just before a cell divides into two new cells. ReferenceRange: Low <6, Intermediate 6-10, >10 High.

children.label: SizeOfGrossTumorBed
children.description: The largest dimension of the gross tumor bed/fibrotic area.

children.label: StagingSystem
children.description: What staging system are used

children.label: StagingTiming
children.description: Indicates when the staging was done, in terms of treatment landmarks, for example, at diagnosis (clinical), at surgery(pathologic), after treatment (post-neoadjuvant), at entry to a clinical trial, or at recurrence.

children.label: T-Stage
children.description: The size and extent of the primary tumor (greatest dimension), based on criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer. See Table 152 in HL7 CDA® R2 Implementation Guide: Clinical Oncology Treatment Plan and Summary, Release 1 - US Realm

children.label: TNMStage
children.description: The stage of a cancer, assessed according to the standard established by American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). TNM Stage Grouping categorizes the progression of cancer using the Roman Numeral system. See Table 140 in HL7 CDA® R2 Implementation Guide: Clinical Oncology Treatment Plan and Summary, Release 1 - US Realm

children.label: TubuleFormationScore
children.description: A comparison between structures formed by the tumor cells as opposed to those formed by normal cells. Scored 1 to 3 with 3 being the most abnormal.

children.label: TumorMarginDescription
children.description: Description of the edge or border of tumor in situ by radiologist or of removed tumor by pathologist.

children.label: TumorMargins
children.description: The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery. The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed. The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

children.label: TumorPrimaryDimensionSize
children.description: The longest diameter of the primary tumor.

children.label: TumorSecondaryDimensionSize
children.description: The longest perpendicular diameter of the primary tumor.

children.label: shr.procedure
children.description: The SHR Lab domain contains definitions related to laboratory measurements, specifically measurements involving specimens.

children.label: Access
children.description: The route used to access the site of a procedure. It is used to distinguish open, closed, and percutaneous procedures.

children.label: AmountOrSize
children.description: The quantity of specimen collected

children.label: AssociatedStudy
children.description: The clinical trial or other formal study related to this procedure.

children.label: DirectSite
children.description: The site where the procedure is performed.

children.label: DirectSiteCode
children.description: The site where the procedure is performed.

children.label: HIVScreeningTestPerformed
children.description: The performance of a HIV Screening Test. Results will be in an accompanying observation.

children.label: HIVScreeningTestRequested
children.description: A request for a rapid HIV screening test.

children.label: HIVSupplementalTestPerformed
children.description: The performance of supplement HIV test, following up an initial screening. Results are in the form of an observation.

children.label: HIVSupplementalTestRequested
children.description: A request for a confirmatory or additional test for HIV infection.

children.label: ImagingProcedureTopic
children.description: Experimental class for an imaging procedure. This class is still incomplete at this time.

children.label: ImagingSubstance
children.description: Substance used for this imaging procedure such as a contrast agent.

children.label: IndirectDevice
children.description: An indirect device used for this procedure.

children.label: IndirectDeviceCode
children.description: An indirect device used for this procedure.

children.label: IndirectSite
children.description: The indirect site for this procedure.

children.label: IndirectSiteCode
children.description: The indirect site for this procedure.

children.label: LaboratoryProcedureTopic
children.description: A procedure performed on a collected specimen such as a blood panel or a biopsy.

children.label: ProcedureTopic
children.description: Description of a healthcare procedure, independent of action context. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

children.label: SpecimenCollectionTopic
children.description: Attribution specific to the collection of a specimen.

children.label: SurgicalApproach
children.description: The technique used to reach the site of the procedure. Approaches may be through the skin or mucous membrane, through an orifice or external.

children.label: SurgicalProcedureTopic
children.description: A surgical action, independent of action context.

children.label: UsingAccessDevice
children.description: The access device used to perform the procedure.

children.label: UsingAccessDeviceCode
children.description: The access device used to perform the procedure.

children.label: UsingDevice
children.description: The device used to perform the procedure.

children.label: UsingDeviceCode
children.description: The device used to perform the procedure.

children.label: shr.research
children.description: The SHR research domain contains definitions related to the clinical trials and research studies.

children.label: Enrollment
children.description: Description of the group or groups enrolled or qualified to be enrolled in the study.

children.label: Jurisdiction
children.description: The country, state or other region taking legal responsibility for the conduct of the study.

children.label: PrincipalInvestigator
children.description: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.

children.label: ResearchSubject
children.description: Record of a subject's enrollment and participation in a research study.

children.label: Sponsor
children.description: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.

children.label: Study
children.description: A clinical trial or similar research study. List of FDA data elements describing a research study: prsinfo.clinicaltrials.gov/definitions.html

children.label: StudyArm
children.description: Arm refers to pre-specified group or subgroup of participant(s) in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

children.label: TerminationReason
children.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

children.label: shr.sex
children.description: The SHR Sex domain contains definitions related to the sexual health and behavior of the person of record.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodFrequency
children.description: How often the contraceptive method is used by the subject.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodReason
children.description: Reason for using a particular contraceptive.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodRequested
children.description: The contraceptive method(s) proposed, recommended or prescribed by a provider, after counseling and assessment.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodRequestedAgainst
children.description: The contraceptive method(s) recommended or prescribed by a provider, after counseling and assessment.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodUsed
children.description: A method contraception used (or not) by the subject.

children.label: ContraceptiveNotUsedReason
children.description: If not using a method of contraception, why.

children.label: ContraceptivesUsed
children.description: How frequently the subject and partner uses contraceptives, and if so, what contraceptive methods used.

children.label: ContraceptiveTopic
children.description: A contraceptive for a patient, independent of context of being recommended, used, or not used.

children.label: CurrentPregnancyStatus
children.description: Whether or not the subject is currently pregnant.

children.label: GenderIdentity
children.description: Subjective personal perception of one's own gender, which can be male, female, a blend of both, or neither.

children.label: IntercourseDifficulty
children.description: Condition affecting sexual intercourse.

children.label: NumberOfLivingChildren
children.description: Number of living children.

children.label: NumberOfPreviousPregnancies
children.description: Number of previous pregnancies.

children.label: NumberOfSexualPartnersPastYear
children.description: Number of sexual partners in past year.

children.label: PregnancyHistory
children.description: Information about current and past pregnancies.

children.label: PregnancyIntention
children.description: Whether the subject or his/her partner has a plan or desire to either become pregnant or have a child in the next year/near future.

children.label: SexualActivity
children.description: Characterization of the sexual activity of the subject.

children.label: SexualBehavior
children.description: Experience with sexual intercourse.

children.label: SexualIdentity
children.description: Information on gender identity and sexual orientation.

children.label: SexualOrientation
children.description: An inherent and enduring emotional, romantic or sexual attraction to other people.

children.label: shr.skin
children.description: SHR implementation of the HL7 Pressure Ulcer Prevention Domain Analysis Model (May, 2011).

children.label: ImmersionDepth
children.description: Depth of penetration (sinking) into a support surface.

children.label: SupportSurface
children.description: A specific instance of a support surface used to distribute pressure and support a patient. The value is coding of the type of support surface.

children.label: SupportSurfaceBodyPosition
children.description: What body positions the surface can be used for, specifically, sitting or lying.

children.label: SupportSurfaceCategory
children.description: The category of support surface.

children.label: SupportSurfaceComponent
children.description: A physical material, structure, or system used alone or in combination with other components to fashion a support surface.

children.label: SupportSurfaceUsed
children.description: A paricular instance of the use of a support surface in patient care.

children.label: VisibleInternalStructure
children.description: An internal body structure visible from outside the body, for example, due to injury.

children.label: WoundAbsent
children.description: Documents the absence of wounds at a given body site.

children.label: WoundAssessment
children.description: Group of observations regarding the properties and severity of a wound.

children.label: WoundBedAndEdge
children.description: Description of the periphery and base of a wound.

children.label: WoundEdgeAppearance
children.description: Evaluation of the state of the tissue at the edge of the wound.

children.label: WoundExudate
children.description: Description of the fluid produced by a wound.

children.label: WoundPresent
children.description: A determination that a wound that exists at a particular body site, implicitly, the wound itself. Multiple wound assessments can be associated with a single wound.

children.label: WoundSize
children.description: The estimated or measured dimensions of a wound.

children.label: WoundTunneling
children.description: A discharging blind-ended track that extends from the surface of an organ to an underlying area or abscess cavity. The track is invariably lined with granulation tissue. In chronic cases this may be augmented with epithelial tissue.

children.label: WoundUndermining
children.description: Assessment of deep tissue (subcutaneous fat and muscle) damage around the wound margin. Tunneling is just under the skin surface and doesn't involve deep tissue, and sinus tracts are a narrow tract that are away from the wound margins and go downward into the wound.

children.label: shr.vital
children.description: The SHR Vital domain contains definitions for basic physiological measurements categorized as vital signs.

children.label: BloodPressure
children.description: The force of circulating blood on the walls of the arteries.

children.label: BodyHeight
children.description: The distance from the sole to the crown of the head.

children.label: BodyLength
children.description: The distance from the sole of the foot to the crown of the head, lying down (typically 0-2 years).

children.label: BodyMassIndex
children.description: A general indicator of the body fat an individual is carrying based upon the ratio of weight to height.

children.label: BodyTemperature
children.description: The measure of the level of heat in a human or animal.

children.label: BodyWeight
children.description: The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. Does not include estimates of fetal bodyweight.

children.label: DiastolicPressure
children.description: The blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood, when the pressure is lowest.

children.label: HeadCircumference
children.description: Circumference of the head (typically 0-2 years).

children.label: HeadTiltAngle
children.description: The angle at which the head is tilted relative to a level position while physiologic tests are taken.

children.label: HeartRate
children.description: The number of times the heart ventricles contract per unit of time, usually per minute.

children.label: OxygenSaturation
children.description: Oxygen saturation in Arterial blood by Pulse oximetry.

children.label: RespiratoryRate
children.description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, expressed as breaths per minute.

children.label: SystolicPressure
children.description: The blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart, when blood pressure is at its highest.

children.label: Mild Adverse Event. Transient or mild discomfort, no limitaion in activity; no medical intervention or therapy required

code.label: Mild Adverse Event. Transient or mild discomfort, no limitaion in activity; no medical intervention or therapy required

children.label: Moderate Adverse Event. Daily activity is affected moderately; some assistance might be needed; no or minimal medical intervention/therapy required.

code.label: Moderate Adverse Event. Daily activity is affected moderately; some assistance might be needed; no or minimal medical intervention/therapy required.

children.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

code.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

children.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

code.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

children.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

code.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

children.label: AttributionCategoryVS
children.description: Whether the adverse event is attributed to a treatment, course of the disease, medical error, unrelated to either, or unknown.

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to an intervention or treatment.

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to an intervention or treatment.

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to the course of the disease

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to the course of the disease

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to a medical error

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to a medical error

children.label: Adverse event is attributed to an cause unrelated to the treatment, disease, or medical error.

code.label: Adverse event is attributed to an cause unrelated to the treatment, disease, or medical error.

children.label: The causal category of the adverse event is unknown

code.label: The causal category of the adverse event is unknown

children.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

code.label: Severe Adverse Event. Daily activity is markedly reduced; some assistance usually required; medical intervention/therapy required, hospitalization or hospice care possible.

children.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

code.label: Potentially Life-Threatening Adverse Event. Extreme limitation to daily activity, significant assistance required; significant medical intervention/therapy, hospitalization or hospice care very likely.

children.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

code.label: Fatal Adverse Event. Adverse event associated with death

children.label: ManifestationVS
children.description: An observable sign or symptom of an underlying physical or psychological cause.

children.label: Condition reported by subject or history provider

code.label: Condition reported by subject or history provider

children.label: AllergyVerificationStatusVS
children.description: Whether the allergy has been verified or not. Intentionally a subset of the codes in FHIR, since refuted would be reflected by correcting the 'elevated risk' element, and records entered in error are not included in SHR.

children.label: AllergenIrritantVS
children.description: Materials, mixtures, classes and categories of materials, including drugs, foods, environmental agents, etc. that may be implicated as a cause of intolerances and allergies.

children.label: NoKnownAllergyVS
children.description: Codes that express no known allergies to food, environmtal agents, drugs, etc.

children.label: ProposedStatusVS
children.description: The status of a proposal.

children.label: The proposal has been proposed, but not accepted or rejected.

code.label: The proposal has been proposed, but not accepted or rejected.

children.label: Active or observant, currently practicing the tenants of the religion

code.label: Active or observant, currently practicing the tenants of the religion

children.label: Occasionally practicing, for example, on special holidays or occasions

code.label: Occasionally practicing, for example, on special holidays or occasions

children.label: ReligiousRestrictionVS
children.description: Includes religious restrictions that could impact care, other than dietary restrictions (handled elsewhere).

children.label: Must have a medical provider of the same sex as the subject

code.label: Must have a medical provider of the same sex as the subject

children.label: Where you sleep (e.g. noisy or uncomfortable environment)

code.label: Where you sleep (e.g. noisy or uncomfortable environment)

children.label: Disturbed by partner snoring or moving

code.label: Disturbed by partner snoring or moving

children.label: Not enough time to sleep enough

code.label: Not enough time to sleep enough

children.label: Trouble breathing, snoring, waking up gasping for breath

code.label: Trouble breathing, snoring, waking up gasping for breath

children.label: Not sleepy at the appropriate time

code.label: Not sleepy at the appropriate time

children.label: Complete response or remission; no measurable or observable evidence of cancer.

code.label: Complete response or remission; no measurable or observable evidence of cancer.

children.label: Progression determined based on physical signs or symptoms

code.label: Progression determined based on physical signs or symptoms

children.label: Progression determined based on physical examination

code.label: Progression determined based on physical examination

children.label: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific signs or symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury.

code.label: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific signs or symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury.

children.label: A disability experienced by the subject.

code.label: A disability experienced by the subject.

children.label: Something the subject is worried about, which may or may not have yet been manifested. The object of the concern does not have to be a medical disorder.

code.label: Something the subject is worried about, which may or may not have yet been manifested. The object of the concern does not have to be a medical disorder.

children.label: A sign or manifestation of a deeper cause, of known or unknown etiology, e.g. pain or ringing in the ears.

code.label: A sign or manifestation of a deeper cause, of known or unknown etiology, e.g. pain or ringing in the ears.

children.label: An adverse reaction to an intervention.

code.label: An adverse reaction to an intervention.

children.label: CurrencyVS
children.description: Value set containing ISO 4217 currency codes.

children.label: The preferred, standardized code for interoperability purposes. There should be only one coding in a CodeableConcept with this tag.

code.label: The preferred, standardized code for interoperability purposes. There should be only one coding in a CodeableConcept with this tag.

children.label: The code found in the information source for this entry, e.g., the raw, original, or first encoding.

code.label: The code found in the information source for this entry, e.g., the raw, original, or first encoding.

children.label: The code was directly selected by the user, as opposed to being determined after the fact via interpretation of notes or natural language processing.

code.label: The code was directly selected by the user, as opposed to being determined after the fact via interpretation of notes or natural language processing.

children.label: The code was determined after-the-fact from source data, either through translation, or via interpretation of free text (by human or machine).

code.label: The code was determined after-the-fact from source data, either through translation, or via interpretation of free text (by human or machine).

children.label: Indicates the code is a less specific term or a categorization of the source or standard code, i.e., a hypernym. For example, a code for 'vital sign' in the context of a body weight measurement would be a category code. Category codes can  be useful for search and query purposes.

code.label: Indicates the code is a less specific term or a categorization of the source or standard code, i.e., a hypernym. For example, a code for 'vital sign' in the context of a body weight measurement would be a category code. Category codes can  be useful for search and query purposes.

children.label: The code is an expression in an expression language defined by the CodeSystem

code.label: The code is an expression in an expression language defined by the CodeSystem

children.label: The code was supplied by the system by default, because no specific coded value was available.

code.label: The code was supplied by the system by default, because no specific coded value was available.

children.label: UpperBoundTypeVS
children.description: Indicates the actual value is lt (<) or lte (<=) the given value.

children.label: The actual value is less than the given value.

code.label: The actual value is less than the given value.

children.label: The actual value is less than or equal to the given value.

code.label: The actual value is less than or equal to the given value.

children.label: LowerBoundTypeVS
children.description: Indicates the actual value is gt (>) or gte (>=) the given value.

children.label: The actual value is greater than the given value.

code.label: The actual value is greater than the given value.

children.label: The actual value is greater than or equal to the given value.

code.label: The actual value is greater than or equal to the given value.

children.label: Temporary employment placement secured by a vocational agency (such as a Fountain House model clubhouse program) and set aside for mental health clients. children.label: BrcaReceptorStatusCS
children.description: Classification of receptor status in breast cancer.

children.label: Group 1. Includes tumors that are ER positive and PR positive, but negative for HER2. Luminal A breast cancers are likely to benefit from hormone therapy and may also benefit from chemotherapy. (http://standardhealthrecord.org/shr/oncology/cs/BrcaReceptorStatusCS:luminal_A)
children.display: Group 1. Includes tumors that are ER positive and PR positive, but negative for HER2. Luminal A breast cancers are likely to benefit from hormone therapy and may also benefit from chemotherapy.

children.label: Group 2. Includes tumors that are ER positive, PR negative and HER2 positive. Luminal B breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy and may benefit from hormone therapy and treatment targeted to HER2. (http://standardhealthrecord.org/shr/oncology/cs/BrcaReceptorStatusCS:luminal_B)
children.display: Group 2. Includes tumors that are ER positive, PR negative and HER2 positive. Luminal B breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy and may benefit from hormone therapy and treatment targeted to HER2.

children.label: Group 3. Includes tumors that are ER negative and PR negative, but HER2 positive. HER2 breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy and treatment targeted to HER2. (http://standardhealthrecord.org/shr/oncology/cs/BrcaReceptorStatusCS:HER2_positive)
children.display: Group 3. Includes tumors that are ER negative and PR negative, but HER2 positive. HER2 breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy and treatment targeted to HER2.

children.label: Group 4. Also called basal-like breast cancer, includes tumors that are ER negative, PR negative and HER2 negative. Basal-like breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy. (http://standardhealthrecord.org/shr/oncology/cs/BrcaReceptorStatusCS:Triple_negative)
children.display: Group 4. Also called basal-like breast cancer, includes tumors that are ER negative, PR negative and HER2 negative. Basal-like breast cancers are likely to benefit from chemotherapy.
